The Exponential Time Hypothesis (ETH) is a conjecture by Impagliazzo et al.  that asserts that there is no 2o​(n)superscript2𝑜𝑛2^{o(n)}-time algorithm for 3-SAT on n𝑛n-variable instances.
This conjecture implies, for instance, that FPT ≠\neq W.
Lokshtanov et al.  survey conditional lower bounds under the ETH. We present some classic W-hard problems which will be used as starting points of our reductions.

The k𝑘k-by-k𝑘k Grid Tiling, or simply Grid Tiling, introduced by Marx  , is a W-hard problem (see for instance 1) which is a convenient starting point to show parameterized hardness for geometric problems  8.
It may turn out useful in other contexts, such as H𝐻H-free graphs [ref]3, and as we will see in this paper for b𝑏b-Chromatic Core.
